CASE (b) m_n < 0: THE GL_n(o/q) FACTORIZATION IS INVALID AND THE FOURIER TRANSFORM IS ILL-DEFINED.

The node opens by asserting that J_K(m) factors through K_n/K_1(q) = GL_n(o/q) 'since both the twist and V^circ are right K_1(q)-invariant.' This is FALSE for m_n < 0.

PROOF THAT THE TWIST IS NOT K_1(q)-INVARIANT WHEN m_n < 0:

For k' in K_1(q), we have (kk')_{nn} = k_{nn} + epsilon, where epsilon = sum_j k_{nj}(k'_{jn} - delta_{jn}). Since k' in K_1(q), we have k'_{jn} - delta_{jn} in p^c for all j, so epsilon in p^c. The twist changes by:

psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} (kk')_{nn}) / psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} k_{nn}) = psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} epsilon).

For K_1(q)-invariance we need Q varpi^{m_n} epsilon in ker(psi) = o for all epsilon in p^c. But val(Q varpi^{m_n} p^c) = (-c) + m_n + c = m_n. When m_n < 0, the product Q varpi^{m_n} epsilon can have NEGATIVE valuation, so psi is nontrivial. Therefore the twist is NOT K_1(q)-invariant for m_n < 0.

CONSEQUENCE: The Fourier transform over o/q is ill-defined. The character x -> psi(Q varpi^{m_n} x) is NOT well-defined on o/q = o/p^c when m_n < 0, because psi(Q varpi^{m_n} (x + p^c)) != psi(Q varpi^{m_n} x) (the character is not constant on cosets of p^c). The entire finite sum representation 'J_K(m) proportional to sum_{x in o/q} psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} x) Phi(a,x)' is MEANINGLESS for m_n < 0, and the 'orthogonality' conclusion has no valid premise.

CORRECT APPROACH (sketch): For m_n < 0, one should NOT reduce to o/q. Instead, use the V^circ-invariance to factor the K_n-integral as an outer sum over K_n/K_1(q) times an inner integral over K_1(q):

J_K(m) = sum_{k-bar in GL_n(o/q)} V^circ(a lift(k-bar)) int_{K_1(q)} psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} (k-bar h)_{nn}) dh.

The inner integral: (k-bar h)_{nn} = k-bar_{nn} + epsilon(k-bar, h) with epsilon in p^c, so the inner integral equals psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} k-bar_{nn}) times int_{K_1(q)} psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} epsilon(k-bar,h)) dh. The map h -> epsilon(k-bar, h) surjects onto p^c (since the last row of k-bar is unimodular in GL_n(o)), and psi^{-1}(Q varpi^{m_n} -) is nontrivial on p^c when m_n < 0 (as shown above). By orthogonality of characters on the compact group, this inner integral vanishes for EVERY k-bar.

The conclusion J_K(m) = 0 for m_n < 0 is almost certainly correct, but via this completely different mechanism (inner integral over K_1(q) vanishes), NOT via the stated Fourier transform over o/q.
